# runningActivity

**Instance Property**

The currently running activity within the currently active context.

## Declaration

```swift
var runningActivity: CLSActivity? { get }
```

## Discussion

This value is `nil` if there is no currently running activity.

If your deployment target is iOS 11.4 or later, you can have more than one activity running concurrently. When you do this, the [doc://com.apple.classkit/documentation/ClassKit/CLSDataStore/runningActivity] property holds the most recently started activity.

## Accessing specific contexts and activities

- **mainAppContext**: The app’s top-level context.
- **activeContext**: The currently active context.
- **fetchActivity(for:completion:)**: Fetches an activity for a given document so you can record progress on the associated task.
- **completeAllAssignedActivities(matching:)**: Marks all of the assigned and active activities for the given context path as complete.
